sense.name: a collaborative association of enterprises or businesses
sense.examples: This consortium of telecommunications companies may constitute a monopoly. It's a large German chemical manufacturing consortium. Several international consortiums now have stakes in U.S. industries.

sense.name: a group of people forming a society, e.g., scholarly
sense.examples: They are forming a consortium of scientists interested in climate change. Mary is a member of a consortium of English-speaking poets.

sense.name: legal rights of marital affection and companionship
sense.examples: The couple enjoyed a happy consortium for sixty years. The princess denied the evil king the consortium he had expected from their marriage.
